topics.title: Quiz Project Overview
topics.theory:
In this final project, you'll build a simple quiz game using everything you've learned: lists, dictionaries, loops, conditions, functions, and input.

The game will ask questions, check answers, and calculate the score.
topics.exercise:
1. Create a dictionary with at least 3 questions and answers.
2. Write a function to ask each question and check the user's answer.
3. Track the score.
4. Print the total correct answers at the end.

practice.title: Practice: Add More Questions
practice.exercise:
1. Add two more questions to the quiz dictionary.
2. Make sure the game handles all questions properly.
practice.theory: Expanding your quiz tests flexibility and understanding of loops and data structures.

practice.title: Practice: Percentage Score
practice.exercise: 1. After the quiz, calculate and print the score as a percentage.
practice.theory: Use arithmetic to convert correct answers to a percent.
